content.title: INTO THE UNDERKEEP (TUTORIAL)
content.body:
Times are changing...

The bravery of adventurers is needed once again. Blackriver, a county of the Kingdom of Elan, has been suffering from macabre events, beginning with the kidnapping of villagers under the cover of night. People are frightened, and monstrous silhouettes wander in the darkness, gnashing teeth and claws.

You arrived late, from far away. In the twilight gloom, wherever you look, there is only desolation and bloodstains painting the walls and alleys red. There’s no sign of your contractor. Or of any living soul, really. Those who remain have locked themselves inside their homes, praying for a miracle.

There is no mystery here: All tracks lead to the Count’s fortress, and whatever is happening there must be what you were hired to stop. Or rather, to fight.

The hair on your arms stands on end—it’s unmistakable...

Blackriver needs your help. First, set up the components as shown below and then read the instructions for this Adventure:

The Hero models must be placed in the positions marked as “Hero Starting Positions.” Each Hero may choose any one of them that is not occupied by another Hero.

These are the Hero Starting Positions for this Adventure.

Monster models must be placed in the indicated positions on the board based on the caption: if 2 players are present, only the elements labeled 2+ are placed; if 3, then place those labeled 2+ and 3+, and so on. When Monsters are spawned on the board, the matching card must immediately be placed on the Initiative Track. Monster cards are always placed in the matching Rune slots, either above or below them according to the arrow shown on the card.

This is where the Vampire card goes on the Initiative Track.

As you place the Monsters in their indicated positions, attach a colored base to each. The bases match the colors on the Monster Status board. It is easiest if you follow the order shown, starting with the yellow one.

Starting with the yellow base, the others should be blue, pink, and then green for the first 4 Monsters.

Mark the Health Points of each Monster on the Monster Status board with a white cube. Their initial (and maximum) value is indicated on their cards.

Use the white cubes to track each Monster’s Health on the Monster Status board. Each Vampire has 12 Health.

These instructions complete the board setup. Let’s move on to the game mechanics.
content.instruction:
SCENARIO OBJECTIVE – DUNGEON CRAWL
To complete this Adventure, you must move through all the rooms, defeating every enemy in your way until you find the Adventure End Trigger.
DEFEAT CONDITIONS – STANDARD
The Adventure immediately fails if any Hero’s Health Points are reduced to 0. The team cannot continue if even just one Hero is defeated.
TUTORIAL – FIRST STEPS
Read the Tutorials “Turns and Rounds,” “Hero Turn,” “Move Action,” “Cube Action,” and “Making Attacks”. You can access these entries in the Tutorial tab of your app whenever you want. To make your early gameplay experience easier, they are also described below.
TUTORIAL – TURNS AND ROUNDS
Chronicles of Drunagor is played over a series of turns and rounds. A turn is the moment when a Character takes Actions. The round is completed when the last Character on the board finishes their Actions. The Initiative Track organizes this process.

This is the Initiative Track and Marker.

  • When the Initiative Marker reaches a Character’s card, it is their turn. When they finish their turn, move the marker to the next card.
  • After the last card on the track has been activated, the marker returns to the first card, starting the next round.
  • The turn order runs from left to right and from the top to the bottom of the track, as if it were a long straight line.
Place the End of the Round Game State Check-Up card at the bottom end of the Initiative Track. It serves as a reminder of some processes that take place at the end of each round.

This is where the End of the Round card goes on the Initiative Track.

TUTORIAL – HERO TURN
Heroes can take the following Actions during their turn, alternating between them as they choose:
  • Take up to one Move Action
  • Take up to two Cube Actions
Heroes are not required to take all the Actions they are entitled to.
We will begin by learning just these two types of Actions. Whenever a new type of Action becomes available to the Heroes, it will come with a complementary set of instructions much like the following.
TUTORIAL – MOVE ACTION
The Move Action is the basic way Heroes move in CoD. It grants 3 movement points that can be used to move around the board.
  • Each square moved into costs 1 movement point.
  • Diagonal movement is allowed and does not cost additional points.
  • Movement up or down board levels does not cost additional points, as long as the change is only one level for each square moved.
  • Heroes can travel through (but not stop in) squares occupied by their allies. They cannot travel through those occupied by enemies, though.
  • Heroes do not need to use all their movement points.
  • If a Hero is moving and decides to take a Cube Action while they still have movement points to spend, those points are lost.
If a Hero wants to take another Move Action in the same turn, they may use a Cube Action to do so: They discard 1 Action Cube from their Pool to take an additional Move Action with 3 movement points, placing the discarded Cube in their “Expended Cubes Box” on their Hero board.
TUTORIAL – CUBE ACTION
“Cube Action” is the name given to any Action where a Hero uses an Action Cube during their turn. Usually, this is to perform one of their Skills. To take a Cube Action, the Hero must spend a Cube of the appropriate color, placing it in the slot corresponding to the Skill they are using. Here are some details about these actions:
  • A Hero can only take Cube Actions during their own turn.
  • The type (color) of the Cube determines the Range for all effects of that Skill:
    • Melee (yellow): Targets Characters adjacent to the Hero.
    • Ranged (red): Targets Characters within Range 1, that is, in any square in the same area (blue square) or in an area adjacent to the one the Hero is in.
    • Agility (green) or Wisdom (blue): Targets Characters anywhere on the board.
  • A Hero is always within Range of any effects they cast themselves.
  • Once an Action Cube is used, it remains slotted into the socket of the Skill it was used to trigger until it is Recalled through a process we’ll cover later, the Recall Action.
  • A Skill is read from left to right, paying attention to the punctuation marks:
    • The first term, followed by a colon (:), indicates the type of Targets that Skill can be used on. “SELF: SHIELD 2” – The allowed target for this effect is SELF, the Hero using this Skill.
    • Comma (,) and AND: These are used as in grammar, uniting the Keywords of a single effect. “SELF: MAKE A OF +3 TO HIT, KEEN, AND +2 DMG” – This Attack has 3 Keywords: +3 TO HIT, KEEN, and +2 DMG.
    • Semicolon (;): Separates two different effects of the same Skill. “SELF: SHIELD 2; ANY TARGET: 2 DMG” – This Skill has two effects. The first of these grants SHIELD 2 to the Hero using it. The second, in turn, deals 2 DMG to any Target within Range.
Cube Actions are the main abilities that Heroes use, and the effects of each Keyword can be found in the Summary. For this Tutorial, each Hero has the ones they use most explained on their Hero Boards.
TUTORIAL – MAKING WEAPON ATTACKS
There is no basic action to Attack in CoD. Attacks are effects provided by Skills and Abilities that the Hero casts, just like any other effect.
Weapon Attack instructions follow the pattern “MAKE A OF +X TO HIT”, followed by any other Keywords that apply to that Attack.
  • The type (color) of the Cube used to trigger the Skill that includes the Attack determines its Range:
    • Melee (yellow): The Attack can hit enemies adjacent to the Hero.
    • Ranged (red): The Attack can hit enemies that are in the same area (blue square) the Hero is in or the area adjacent to it. Heroes who are adjacent to enemies, however, cannot make Ranged (red) . This is called “Combat Engagement”.
  • The player rolls the D20 and adds any TO HIT bonuses (+X TO HIT). If the Roll equals or exceeds their Weapon’s Accuracy value (in the blue diamond), the Attack hits and causes the damage indicated on that Weapon card, plus any damage bonuses the Attack has.
    • If the Roll is a “natural” 20 (value rolled before any modifiers), the Attack is a Critical Hit—It deals double damage.
    • If the Roll is a “natural” 1, the Attack is a Critical Failure—They miss even if the To Hit bonus would be enough to hit.
  • Attacks made by a Hero who is on a board level above their Target gain a +2 TO HIT bonus, while those made from below the Target receive a -2 TO HIT penalty.
Once these steps are completed, the Attack is complete.

Vorn is Attacking through his Arcing Strike Skill. Since Vorn’s Dwarven Warhammer has Accuracy 7 and his Skill provides a +3 TO HIT bonus, he must score at least a 4 on the D20 for the Attack to hit and deal damage.

STARTGAME TRIGGER
Now that you’ve completed the first Tutorial readings, place the Initiative Marker on Vorn’s (or the Hero who is playing the Defender role if it is not Vorn) Initiative card. That Hero can move to reach a Monster and make Attacks () against it. For purposes of this Tutorial, if the Vampire is killed, keep it on the board with 1 Health so as not to interfere with the following Tutorials. Once the Defender’s turn ends (after taking their Move Action and Two Cube Actions), move the Initiative marker to the next card, the Vampire Monster, and read “The Monsters’ Turn” and “Reactions” in the Tutorial tab of your app.

You may begin to play the Adventure.

content.title: HAIL TO HIS MAJESTY
content.body:
Madness. The only word that fits this moment.

Corrupted creatures laid siege to the city from the inside out, abducting villagers night after night to sacrifice them in a ritual to a dreadful entity. A classic tale.

When the last of the aberrations falls, the chorus goes silent and the world around you begins to tremble as if the ground were about to split in two. The shadows dance as if they’ve come to life, and you find it hard to describe what unfolds before your eyes.

“Hahaha! What is this?” echoes a hoarse laugh, coming from nowhere—sounding as if it emerged from a decaying corpse. Slowly, the darkness swirls and joins together to form a monster unlike anything you’ve ever seen before: fifteen feet tall, a crown on its head, and the spine of a giant wielded like a weapon by skeletal hands. “Why resist? Everything that lives, sooner or later, dies. It’s not a matter of ‘if’, but ‘when’—and for you, that moment is now…”

The monster behind Blackriver’s downfall has emerged from the shadows. Make the following preparations for your first Boss Fight:
  • Flip the second Monster Status Board (from orange to brown).
  • Set the Undead King’s starting Health Points. He has 25 HP for each Hero (for a total between 25 and 100).
  • Grab the Undead King’s Monster card, along with his 4 First Encounter Boss Attack cards, and place them with the “FRONT” side facing up in the designated slots of the Initiative Track.
  • Place the Undead King’s model on Map E11-F, occupying the central emerald-colored area. If any Hero is in that area, they must reposition their model to a square adjacent to the villain.
  • Replace the Hail to His Majesty Scene Trigger card on the Initiative Track with the Age of Darkness card.
  • Finally, each Hero on a square of Bridge BR2-B or any Map from the previous Setups must move their model to a square on Map E12-F. Those Heroes suffer FATIGUE X, with X being the number of squares they had to move. They take 1 non-preventable damage for each AC they should discard but couldn’t.
  • Remove Bridge BR2-B from the board. Heroes can no longer access previous Setup areas under any circumstances. Pets on the Bridge or previous Setups are Dispelled.
A Boss Battle is about to begin. Read the Tutorials “Boss Battles” and “Focus Abilities”. Then read the rule below before continuing the Adventure.
THIS IS NOT OVER YET
When the Undead King dies for the first time, do not remove his model from the board or his cards from the Initiative Track. Skip all ACTIVATIONS from his Attack and Monster cards while he is in this suspended state. Heroes being GRAPPLED by the Undead King are released into a square adjacent to the Undead King’s model.

content.title: AGE OF DARKNESS
content.body:
The author of Blackriver’s misery is not a man. Not anymore. Now he is a carcass corrupted by the same unholy power he claims dominion over. Without a soul to long for anything, all he seeks is death and destruction.

“Who the hell are you?” the monster demands. The living usually don’t strike back. “You’re strong, I’ll admit that—but this ends now. The seeds have already been planted. There is no more escape, no more rest!”

Boulders fall from the ceiling as the Undead King raises his hands and makes the hall tremble once again. Your legs fight to stay grounded, but it is your mind that reels at the sight of a nightmare. Shadows condense like black clouds, flashing with emerald light. Then, like a storm, something warm and sticky as pitch spills into the hall.

The falling slime creeps along the floor and devours corpses with the hunger of a predator, sending a shiver down your spine. Flesh, entrails, and bones vanish in the blink of an eye, thickening and strengthening the mass that oozes ever closer.

“Welcome, mortals... to the Age of Darkness!”

The Undead King is not yet defeated and summons the Darkness to aid him. Make the following preparations for the second stage of this Boss Fight:
  • The Undead King restores 20 Health Points per Hero (for a total between 20 and 80).
  • Flip all of the Undead King’s Attack cards to their BACK side.
  • The Undead King releases all Heroes who are GRAPPLED.
  • Flip Maps E8-B and E5-F. Remove any Special Event tokens from them, but leave all other elements in their current squares (including Rune Piles). Heroes on these Maps are engulfed by Darkness.
  • Replace the Age of Darkness Scene Trigger card with the Into the Underkeep Endgame Trigger card.
With these preparations complete, read the Tutorial “Darkness”.

content.title: INTO THE UNDERKEEP
content.body:
What takes place in the Great Hall is the embodiment of life’s struggle, as the adrenaline surging through your veins turns any dreams of wealth or glory into a single purpose: survival. Violence is met with violence, but in the end, the final blow is delivered by you.

“How... How can flesh surpass death?” the skeletal colossus murmurs as he collapses to the ground—but surprisingly, he laughs again. The black mass had already infiltrated the fortress’s foundations, shaking the ground harder than ever. “You know what? It doesn’t matter. You’ve won nothing but the right to dig your own graves...”

You barely have time to look at each other, let alone think of fleeing, before the cacophony of the collapse silences the hall, raising dust everywhere. All that’s left is to take a deep breath and hope for the best.

Surely, this job is turning out to be more costly than you expected…

Congratulations! You’ve completed the Drunagor Nights Season 01, Tutorial!
Register your Heroes by marking in the app the Skills, Class Abilities, and Equipment you own. Proceed to the Adventure Underkeep Level 01 for your next game session—or if you prefer, replay this adventure in Advanced Mode first.

The hold of Darkness is strong here: Draw 24 Runes and place them on the Initiative Track. 12 remain in the bag, enough for 9 complete rounds before a Rune will fail to be drawn.

content.title: THE UNDERKEEP LEVEL 01
content.body:
Screams, pain, and despair.

The ground gives way beneath your feet, dragging you into a sinkhole. Instinctively, you curl up like turtles as you fall, your ears ringing with the echo of another cadaverous laugh fading into the distance.

At long last, the world around you settles and falls silent and you are able to regain your feet. Every part of your body aches, though it could’ve ended much worse. 

You find yourself on a floor made of raw stone slabs, rough and uncomfortable. There is barely any light, except for a sinister emerald glow flickering from the walls, fueling that murderous shadowy mass. It is here too, of course. Staining the walls like a giant creeping vine, gathering strength to strike at the right moment. 

Turning back is no longer possible, and staying is not an option. This is no longer an incursion—it’s a battle for survival, and you are the prey.

Surely, you should have read the fine print of that contract…

You are cornered and must survive Blackriver’s dungeon. First, set up the Initial Setup and then read the Scenario Instructions for this Adventure:
content.instruction:
SCENARIO OBJECTIVE – DUNGEON CRAWL
To complete this Adventure, you must advance through all the rooms defeating every enemy along the way until you find the Adventure End Trigger.
DEFEAT CONDITIONS – STANDARD
The Adventure immediately fails when one of the following occurs: 1) A Rune cannot be drawn from the bag; 2) any Hero collects their 2nd Trauma Cube; or 3) any Hero acquires their 6th Curse Cube. The team cannot proceed if any Hero is defeated.
RECALL ACTION PENALTY – DOUBLE
Whenever Heroes take a Voluntary or Involuntary Recall Action, after completing the Action they are performing and recovering their Cubes, they receive 2 Curse Cubes.
GAME MECHANIC – GROWING DARKNESS
Darkness lurks in the shadows, but it is too weak to manifest. Place the Growing Darkness Rune card with face A up in the Rune Slot at the bottom of the Initiative Track.
GAME MECHANIC – THE UNDERKEEP
Doors are opened differently in this Adventure: Place the End of Round Game State Check-Up card in the Rune Slot at the bottom of the Initiative Track, just below the Rune card, with face A up. It will help you manage this mechanic.
DUNGEON ACTION – STIRRING DARKNESS
Darkness holds strong here: Draw 30 Runes and place them on the Initiative Track. 6 remain in the bag, enough for 5 full rounds before a Rune will fail to be drawn.
RULE – LOCKED DOOR
Door 01 cannot be opened until another effect states otherwise.
STARTGAME TRIGGER
With the Setup ready and all these instructions read, you may begin playing the Adventure.

content.title: DOWN THE RIVER
content.body:
The gates have opened, and the unmistakable sound of water flowing over stone echoes through the cistern. Quickly, the first third of the volume drains away, ending the stillness of waters left untouched for years—decades, perhaps centuries. Childhood lessons flash through your mind: disturbing things that lie in peace is almost never a good idea. Should you really have done that?

If the Locked Mechanism Status is noted on the Party’s Campaign Log, the wheel prevents the gates from closing and nothing special happens. Otherwise, continue reading below:
The force of the water pouring through the drains forces the gates to close on their own, returning the mechanism to its resting state…
Flip the Drainage Game Mechanic card to face B again.
Proceed with the Adventure.

content.title: LURKING FROM THE DEPTHS
content.body:
The gates open, water continues to pour through the drains like an underground river. The second third of the volume drains, revealing an unpleasant surprise: the Darkness is there. The reservoir does not just hold the precious liquid of life, but also death. What other secrets lie at the bottom? Do you really want to know? Suddenly, another internal mechanism activates, and one of the chamber walls retracts into the stone, revealing a door long forgotten…

Flip Map DNC5-F to side DNC5-B and add the following elements to the Setup:

If the Locked Mechanism Status is noted on the Party’s Campaign Log, the wheel prevents the gates from closing and nothing special happens. Otherwise, continue reading below:
The force of the water pouring through the drains forces the gates to close on their own, returning the mechanism to its resting state…
Flip the Drainage Game Mechanic card to face B again.
Proceed with the Adventure.

content.title: THE BOTTOM OF THE PIT
content.body:
The last of the water drains into the stone, but the vortex is not strong enough to drag the Darkness with it. Exposed once again, the black miasma begins to slither as if it had been waiting for this moment all along, hungrier than ever. The enemy is once again on your trail. But not all the reservoir’s secrets are grim: treasures also lie in the dark, an inheritance from the unfortunate souls of ages past… Were they adventurers like you? Or perhaps the power-hungry men who brought this thing to life?

Remove both the Drainage Game Mechanic card from the Initiative Track and the Interaction token from the board.

Replace Map DNC5-B with Map DNC2-B and add the following elements to the Setup:

GAME MECHANIC – DARKNESS HUNTING
The Darkness is now strong enough to hunt new victims. Replace the Growing Darkness Rune card on the Initiative Track with the Darkness Hunting card, keeping the same face up. The Darkness now chases the Heroes according to the Standard Behavior.
  • Consider the Darkness Nodes to be the Spawn Points for Darkness tiles instead of those printed on the Maps.
  • if there are no Nodes on the board when a Rune is drawn, do not Spawn that tile.
You can find details about Darkness Spawning and its Effects here. Reminder: If all Heroes are already in Darkness when a Rune is drawn, they suffer CRUSH damage instead of spawning Darkness.
Proceed with the Adventure.

content.title: THE REUNION
content.body:
Then, as if from nowhere once again, there he is—the Undead King in all his decaying glory. Defeat seems to have affected him little.

“Life is persistent. Stubborn. Indeed, it always finds a way…” taunts the unforgettable raspy voice. “How many times has Drunagor survived the ‘End of the World’ only to find itself again in the same situation? A pointless struggle with no end…”

You hesitate. Part of you wants to see the man inside that husk, but Darkness is not a disease—it’s something far worse. There is no cure for it, as it plagues both flesh and mind.

“Life is overrated. The future of all creatures is unlife. A perpetual existence with no pain, no greed, no need. Why fight destiny? What we offer—isn’t it what you seek? Ascension?”

It takes only that spark of blasphemy to make your blood boil…

The worst phrase imaginable has become reality: Somehow, the Undead King has returned. Make the following preparations for this Boss Fight:
  • Flip the second Monster Status Board (from orange to brown).
  • Set the Undead King’s starting Health Points. He has 60 HP for each Hero (for a total between 60 and 240).
  • Take the Undead King Monster card, along with his 4 Second Encounter Boss Attack cards, and place them with the “FRONT” side facing up in the designated slots of the Initiative Track.
Now, each Hero and Pet repositions their model in the spaces indicated by the Setup. Each Hero suffers FATIGUE 1 for each area (not square) they must move through to reach one of these positions. If necessary, they must take Involuntary Recovery Actions during this movement, but they do not suffer damage for stepping into Darkness. Finally, if a Hero would receive their 5th or 6th Curse Cube this way, that Hero does not receive them.
GAME MECHANIC – SUDDEN DEATH
The Undead King had to spend Darkness energy to restore himself, weakening it. Remove the Darkness Hunting Rune card from the Initiative Track. Until the end of this Adventure, Darkness no longer pursues the Heroes—but that doesn’t mean they have much time to defeat him. The Undead King’s Attack cards draw many Runes per round.
GAME MECHANIC – REALM OF CHAOS
The chaotic and cursed influence of this level also affects the Undead King’s Attacks. Whenever a card instructs you to “DRAW 1 RUNE AND 'LOCK-ON' THE APPROPRIATE TARGET AT ANY RANGE”, it means the target of that Attack is determined by the color of the Rune drawn:
  • ORANGE – Strongest Hero at Any Range.
  • GREEN – Most Vigorous Hero at Any Range. The Most Vigorous Hero is the one with the most Available Action Cubes on their board at that moment. If two or more Heroes are tied, the one who acts first on the Initiative Track is considered the Most Vigorous.
  • BLUE – Most Tired Hero at Any Range. The Most Tired Hero is the one with the fewest Available Action Cubes on their board. If two or more Heroes are tied, the one who acts last on the Initiative Track is the Most Tired among them.
  • RED – Weakest Hero at Any Range.
  • GRAY – Most Corrupted Hero at Any Range.
Note that not all of the Undead King’s Attacks are affected by this Game Mechanic. Those that draw Runes but do not determine “LOCK-ON” do not follow these instructions.
Finally, no Character may occupy spaces outside this hall, as if the rest of the dungeon had ceased to exist. When these preparations are complete, proceed with the Adventure. Reminder: The Monster Raid Game Mechanic is still in effect during this fight.

content.title: TO THE DARK AND BEYOND
content.body:
Darkness, minions, and a flirt with death make this battle just as intense as the first—but you muster every ounce of determination within you and bring the villain to his knees once more, filling yourselves with renewed confidence.

“Oh… I can feel it…” The monster’s laugh makes you question whether it’s all a façade, or if he truly doesn’t care about dying again and again. “Do not celebrate, mortals. I shall rise once more—for I transcended the weakness of flesh long, long ago.”

Then, as if centuries were passing in the blink of an eye, his once ornate garments crumble into dust along with the bones inside. The crown is the last to fall, disintegrating into rust as it hits the ground.

The Darkness nodes weaken, and the great mold covering the walls dissolves, revealing staircases plunging into the heart of the dungeon. Any adventurer might think it’s time to set up camp and rest—but that is a luxury you cannot afford.

This isn’t over yet…

Congratulations! You’vecompleted the second Wing of Drunagor Nights!
Register your Heroes in the Chronicles of Drunagor app, marking the Skills, Class Abilities, and Equipment you possess. Proceed to the Adventure Underkeep Level 02 for your next game session.
